Articles.Content:
Project Singularity was a challenge I created and took on privately. The idea was to create a all-stock, single-stage rocket capable of reaching a low orbit and getting home in one piece to be reused. Not wanting to waste even a single part, I did away with boosters, instead relying on a high amount of fuel. After many revisions, I prepared to launch the design I was most confident in. This was the result...

A nice, sunny day for a launch.

LIFTOFF!

Polar orbit achieved.

Re-entry over the south pole.

Parachutes deployed.

Engine assistance before touchdown.

Project Singularity has landed. (Engines breaking fixed in download.)

Download:
The copy I downloaded had two unconnected struts... test flying, brb!
